body:
**What happened**: The [`ToString` receiver on the `v1.Taint` type generates the string](https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/blob/33b20f2/pkg/apis/core/taint.go#L33) "key:effect" when the `Value` of the taint is the empty string.

Because the generated string has no `=` character, when it is passed to the `parseTaint` method in `pkg/util/taints`, the method returns an error.

I discovered this issue by defining a taint in a kubeadm configuration file. kubeadm converted the taint to a string, then passed the string to kubelet using the `--register-with-taints` flag, and kubelet threw an error.

**What you expected to happen**:
I expect the `ToString` receiver on the `v1.Taint` type to only generate strings that are accepted by the `parseTaint` method in `pkg/util/taints`. Conversely, I expect the `parseTaint` method to accept any string generated by the `ToString` receiver on the `v1.Taint` type.

**How to reproduce it (as minimally and precisely as possible)**:
The following program demonstrates the issue. I compiled it using the `release-1.13` branch. It initializes a `Taint` struct with the `Value` field left as an empty string. It then converts the struct to a string. Finally, it calls `utils.NewTaintsVar`, just as kubelet does [here](https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/blob/release-1.13/cmd/kubelet/app/options/options.go#L406). Subsequently, [a call to `Set` ](https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/blob/5fdad5c/pkg/util/taints/taints.go#L85) returns an error that originates in the `parseTaint` method.
```
package main

import (
	"fmt"

	"k8s.io/api/core/v1"
	"k8s.io/kubernetes/pkg/apis/core"
	utiltaints "k8s.io/kubernetes/pkg/util/taints"
)

func main() {
	t := v1.Taint{
		Key:    "node-role.kubernetes.io/master",
		Effect: v1.TaintEffectNoSchedule,
	}
	s := t.ToString()
	ptr := []core.Taint{}
	tv := utiltaints.NewTaintsVar(&ptr)
	if err := tv.Set(s); err != nil {
		fmt.Println(err)
	}
}

```
Output:
```
invalid taint spec: node-role.kubernetes.io/master:NoSchedule
```

title: Taint-to-string method generates string that taint parser considers invalid
